thread.title: Pub customers and bouncers use chairs to fight off man armed with machete - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Pub customers and bouncers use chairs to fight off man armed with machete - Manchester Evening News

author: Sam Yarwood
title: Pub customers and bouncers use chairs to fight off man armed with machete - Manchester Evening News
text:
Pub customers and bouncers use chairs to fight off man armed with machete Police were called when the man tried to attack people at the pub in Stockport last night Share The James Watts pub on High Street in Cheadle, formerly The Star Inn Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Pub bouncers used chairs to fight off a man who tried to attack them with a machete in Stockport . 
With the help of punters the man was disarmed and detained until police arrived. 
Greater Manchester Police confirmed they were called to The James Watts, formerly The Star Inn, on High Street in Cheadle at around 10pm on Friday night. 
It’s understood the man had either been refused entry or kicked out of the venue earlier that evening before returning with the knife in a sheath. 
After again arguing with door staff, he produced the machete and began threatening them with it. 
Witnesses say they heard a loud commotion outside and looked through the windows to see the bouncers using chairs to defend themselves from the knifeman. 
A number of customers then went outside to help. Read More Teenager stabbed in the street in north Manchester 
A customer who was inside at the time told the M.E.N: “We were just sat there having a drink when all of a sudden we heard banging and a load of commotion coming from outside. 
“The bouncers were trying to fight off this guy with a machete using chairs, then some people from the pub went to help and managed to get the knife off him and hold him down until the police came. 
“When it was all done they came back inside and there was a round of applause for them, then everyone just kept enjoying their drinks.” High Street in Cheadle (Photo: Google) 
A spokesman for GMP said that officers had arrested a man on suspicion of affray in connection with the incident. 
They said: “We were called just before 9.55pm on Friday night to a pub on High Street in Cheadle to reports that a man had turned up with a machete and was threatening door staff who used chairs to defend themselves. Read More 
“The man was detained before police arrived and was arrested on suspicion of affray. 
“No one is believed to have been injured.” 
The James Watts is run by Hydes Brewery and has recently been refurbished and renamed from The Star Inn. 
Hydes have been approached for comment. Like us on Facebook
